fields.summary: Deleting Load Balancer That Spans Multiple AZs (clusters) Fails to Delete the Associated Autoscaling Group

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
*Assessment*

In Eucalyptus 3.4, when a user deploys an ELB, there is an associated autoscaling group that gets launched as well.  The autoscaling group is not viewable by the user directly (i.e. euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups).  The cloud administrator sees the autoscaling group associated with the ELB.  It would be helpful to document this behavior in the Administration Guide, so the cloud admin can have a heads up as to how ELB is actually deployed on Eucalyptus. 

*Signs*

After deploying an ELB, the following resources can be viewed by the non-eucalyptus account user:
{code}
# eulb-create-lb -z Exodus -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" Papine-Mona --region account1-user02@
DNS_NAME	Papine-Mona-735723906303.lb.localhost
# eulb-describe-lbs --region account1-user02@
LOAD_BALANCER	Papine-Mona	Papine-Mona-735723906303.lb.localhost	2013-11-04T14:10:19.232Z
# eulb-describe-lbs --region account1-user02@ --show-long
LOAD_BALANCER	Papine-Mona	Papine-Mona-735723906303.lb.localhost			{interval=30,target=TCP:80,timeout=5,healthy-threshold=3,unhealthy-threshold=2}	Exodus				{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80}					{owner-alias=407837561996,group-name=euca-internal-735723906303-Papine-Mona}		2013-11-04T14:10:19.232Z
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region account1-user02@
#
# euca-describe-instances --region account1-user02@
#
{code}

Here is the view from the cloud-admin (user in eucalyptus account):
{code}
# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region eucalyptus-admin@ --show-long
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	asg-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Papine-Mona	lc-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Papine-Mona-9d0d59a9	Exodus	2013-11-04T14:10:22.765		EC2	1	1	1	300	0			arn:aws:autoscaling::407837561996:autoScalingGroup:4b105585-de10-4008-a727-20336c02bfd0:autoScalingGroupName/asg-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Papine-Mona	Default
INSTANCE	i-02133E2B	Exodus	InService	Healthy	lc-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Papine-Mona-9d0d59a9
# euca-describe-instances verbose --region eucalyptus-admin@
RESERVATION	r-5C3041EB	407837561996	euca-internal-735723906303-Papine-Mona
INSTANCE	i-02133E2B	emi-F4763190	10.104.7.21	172.17.185.169	running		0		m1.small	2013-11-04T14:10:31.024Z	Exodus	eki-54CD3744	eri-C66835FE		monitoring-enabled	10.104.7.21	172.17.185.169			instance-store					paravirtualized		8c4c6b23-0074-4d48-887a-9af99ac96f3e_Exodus_1				arn:aws:iam::407837561996:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm
TAG	instance	i-02133E2B	Name	loadbalancer-resources
TAG	instance	i-02133E2B	aws:autoscaling:groupName	asg-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Papine-Mona
TAG	instance	i-02133E2B	euca:node	10.105.10.11
{code}
fields.summary: Discuss Deployment Model of ELB on Eucalyptus in Administration Guide and User Guide
fields.environment:
*non-HA, multi-cluster*
** 1 x CLC/Walrus
** 2 x CC/SC (one CC/SC per cluster)
** 2 x NCs (one NC per cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:eucalyptus:autoscaling:autoscaling:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Jetty  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Euare  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cluster        	Exodus         	NaturalMystic  	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.22:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:cluster:NaturalMystic/
SERVICE	cluster        	Legend         	IsThisLove     	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.1.185:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:cluster:IsThisLove/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	StirItUp       	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Walrus 	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:StirItUp/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Tokens 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Dns    	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	storage        	Exodus         	TheHeathen     	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.22:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:storage:TheHeathen/
SERVICE	storage        	Legend         	NoWomanNoCry   	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.1.185:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:storage:NoWomanNoCry/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.6/
